page.title: 10CHURCHES IN THE AREA.
page.content: Doulting Church is dedicated to{St. {Aldhelm}and has been restored and re-built three times. In 1869 when it was re-built last , the tower and spire were completely re-built. The church has got 6 bells but they can't be rung. It has got a cross in the churchyard. The church at Cranmore is dedicated to{St. Bartholomew}and is smaller than Doulting's church. It has got 5 bells, and it has also got a cross in the churchyard. Both these churches are looked after by the vicars in Shepton Mallet: Revds. Woolmer and Barton. Chesterblade's church is dedicated to{St. Mary}and is part of{Evercreech}Parish. It has got one bell and in 1926 when the ceiling was restored they found the beautiful {oak}roof underneath it. It is a very small church.
